title: Feature: emit error when shuttle::main function is named main
body:
## Description of change

Emit a clear error when a shuttle_runtime::main function is named `main`, which does not work since the codegen generates a main function.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

I added a test and I tested a modified example manually.

title: Feature: eng 484 update init with codegen changes
body:
## Description of change

This updates init with the shuttle-next changes, copied from the updated examples that have been tested with local run. I ended up ignoring 5 tests since they try to fetch `shuttle-rocket` from crates.io and that hasn't been published yet, but I added a `TODO` to each.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Updated and made sure all tests that can pass do pass. See above for ignored tests. We will also test init as part of the pre-release QA.

title: [next] tests: CI go green
body:
## Description of change
Fixes up the last few tests in the next branch to make sure they will all pass.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Using `cargo test`

title: feat: extract service integrations into separate crates
fix: Respect `Cargo.lock` when building containers
body:
Building the shuttle containers was failing during the `cargo chef cook` step because of a cyclic dependency introduced by an upstream crate. This did not happen when building outside of a container, because the versions pinned by `Cargo.lock` did not contain any cycles.

See https://github.com/tkaitchuck/aHash/issues/95

title: Feature/eng 486 update deployer with runtime changes
body:
## Description of change

This updates deployer to work with the changes we made to the runtime. So for legacy it starts the users project with the embedded runtime (and sends the path to the same runtime in the load request, but it isn't used in the legacy runtime load function), and for shuttle-next it installs and starts the shuttle-next runtime binary, and then sends the users compiled .wasm file in the load request.

TODO:

- [ ] Can probably clean up some of the code in deployer.
- [ ] Figure out if we fix the tests here or after merging/backporting changes from https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/580

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Most of the tests pass, but the ones that deal with a project crashing or stopping don't. This is likely solved in https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/580, so I'm not sure if we need to do it in this PR.

body:

We are bumping static folder and publishing a release of that, as well as redeploying gateway and deployer so the gateway uses the new deployer, the new deployer is necessary since it uses patched local versions of the resource libraries.

title: bug: idle static folder
body:
## Description of change

This fixes static folder projects not starting up correctly after they went into idle mode. This would happen because the static folder resource would move the folder and therefore could not move it a second time when an idle project is woken up.

This change causes the static folder resource to rather copy the folder.

Closes issue #689 

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Locally, with a full running setup and the axum websocket example

title: docs: add note about git tags in contrib
body:
## Description of change

Depending on how users clone the repo the tags may not be fetched. Add a note about this and how to do it to contrib.

title: Feature/eng 477 make wasm dependencies optional
body:
## Description of change

The WASI dependencies for shuttle-next are quite heavy. This PR makes them optional, and the next-runtime bin dependent on the `next` feature.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Ran legacy and next, they still work as expected, but legacy has fewer dependencies.

title: Fix indentation for poise init example

First line in the generated `src/lib.rs` file for poise project was wrongly indented. Fixing the indentation in `indoc!` fixes it.

title: refactor: find code to wrap legacy runtime
body:
## Description of change
This finds the new code that we will need to codegen to start a legacy service with our new runtime.

With this change we will also be able to do the following:
- Get rid of the `Sync` requirement for services
- Get rid of the `runtime` in resources
- Correctly stop deploys
- Get rid of the FFI :partying_face: :tada: :confetti_ball: 

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Manually using `grpcurl`

title: Fix/move docker profiles to dev
body:
## Description of change

Docker swarm does not support docker profiles, so to be able to run the deploy command we had to remove these from `docker-compose.yml`. We fix this by moving them into `docker-compose.dev.yml` so they are only applied to the local runs.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Verified that the local behavior is the same, and we deployed yesterday after removing the profiles from the main compose file.

title: bug: ws not getting logs from broadcast channel
body:
This fixes the WebSocket connection returning early which made it seem like deployments are done, when in reality they were not.

We have no idea why the sqlite setting is affecting the broadcast channel however. I suspect it is causing some panic inside the thread, which is in persistence, that would have send the log to the broadcast channel.

- Updated docs for `cargo-shuttle` to keep it up to date

title: Remove time v0.1 dependency from main crates
body:
- Mongodb v2.4.0 got rid of its time v0.1 dependency. This plus removing default features on chrono results in all of shuttle's main  crates not depending on it (by default, shuttle-service with thruster still does due to thruster's direct dependency on it).
- Removed Cargo.lock from .gitignore since it is being tracked by git.

title: feat: add bug report and PR templates
body:
This adds a bug report template that users can choose when opening an issue, that requires the user to include some information that is usually needed. To see how it looks rendered, click view file. Or see this link: https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/blob/f0a5066244b414cec93dabbacf2a4ab0c389dead/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/BUG-REPORT.yml

The user will be able to choose the bug report template or a blank issue (when we add more templates we can disable blank templates), or they can choose to follow a link to our discord.

It also adds a PR template to encourage contributors to self-review and add docs/tests.

Closes #602

title: Feat: unbox the ClaimService and Scoped futures
body:
We can unbox the future type in tower layers if we implement future ourselves. For how I landed on the implementation for ClaimService, see: https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/blob/master/guides/building-a-middleware-from-scratch.md

For what inspired the enum solution for the Scoped future, see: https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/blob/master/tower/src/load_shed/future.rs#L13-L63

Remove the target from the binary name to be compatible with binstall, and also switch to using only the short-form git tag.

See first commit's workflow run for successful run, and see the new draft release in releases for a preview of the binaries.

title: refactor: get project name from label

body: Expand a bit on some of the commands and restructure parts of the document.

title: feat: auth cache
body:
This PR adds a cache in front of the reverse proxy in the `ShuttleAuthLayer` that tries to upgrade a cookie or api-key bearer token to a JWT. The cache is first checked for the key (cookie or api-key), if it is there set it on the request in the `ShuttleAuthLayer`. If it isn't, request an upgrade from the `auth` server through the proxy. If it succeeds, extract the token from the proxy response and set it in the cache, before setting it on the request and proceeding.

It would have been more elegant to have the cache be a layer on the proxy client, but I had some difficulty implementing this. It's certainly something we should consider in the future.

All tests pass except for one assertion in the `api_create_get_delete_projects` test, which is commented out. It was indeed broken, but it was testing functionality we don't have.

body: In the previous implementation stop service would just return a list of the deployments fetched before stopping the service, so it would show as running. This changes it to return a summary of the active deployment and a progress bar until it's stopped (which is almost immediate).

title: bug: make Stopped a sink state
Feat: optimize sqlite db in deployer and gateway
body:
Up until sqlx 0.6.1 sqlite databases were created in [WAL mode](https://www.sqlite.org/wal.html) by default, which should be more performant. Our gateway DB was created before 0.6.1 and WAL mode is a permanent setting, so it's still in WAL mode. Since we're now on 0.6.2 we need to explicitly set it to WAL mode so new DBs are created in it. 

On top of that, using the `NORMAL` [synchronous setting](https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous) is durable and corruption-proof in WAL mode, and it is more performant then the default `FULL` setting.

Sources: sqlite docs linked above, https://phiresky.github.io/blog/2020/sqlite-performance-tuning/ and https://activesphere.com/blog/2018/12/24/understanding-sqlite-busy

TODO: stress test this and see if it resolves the deadlock.

title: feat: implement rpc method in provisioner that allows for the deletion of resources
body: Addresses the first step of https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/issues/615 by implementing an rpc method in the provisioner that allows for the deletion of resources.

title: feat: retry on bollard errors
body:
This adds three new project states to improve the stability of project creation:
1. `Recreating` to recreate a container from scratch that failed to connect to the network
2. `Restarting` to try to start a container that failed to start
3. `Rebooting` to reboot container that became unhealthy

This causes the `Stopped` state to become a sink / dead end.

Things still to do:
- [x] Communicate restart / recreate attempts on the CLI

title: feat: rename delete to stop
body:
According to [this comment](https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/616#issuecomment-1421255649), it's not necessary to remove the service from the database and we only need to stop it.
So, in the deployer, we can rename the `delete_service` function to `stop_service` and just remove the persistence line for dropping the service in database.

Considering this endpoint no longer deletes the service but just stops it, we can rename the delete command to stop in cargo-shuttle.

This should fix #561

title: feat: Allow filtering projects by project status
body:
* Adds a flag to allow filtering projects by deployment status.

Ref: Issue #612 

Notes:
Please ignore logout function removal - this is due to incorrect branching from an earlier PR unfortunately, some caution may not have been exercised 😅

title: Release flag
body: Fixes #609

title: feat: add dev/prod secrets functionality
body:
* Local deployments now use `Secrets.dev.toml` by default

* Added a flag to `run_args` that allows usage of prod secrets in a local deployment should the user need to do so

Ref: Issue #563 

Notes:
I was thinking about using `Secrets.prod.toml` as a filename for live deployment but it will probably break any and all deployments currently using `Secrets.toml`, as well as there being an example project in testing that currently uses `Secrets.toml`, so until there's further consideration about how to deal with live deployments that currently use secrets it's probably a good idea to leave this unchanged until a discussion on how to solve this has been made.

title: fix: add repo url to cargo-shuttle for binstall
body:
[`cargo-binstall`](https://github.com/cargo-bins/cargo-binstall/blob/main/SUPPORT.md#support-for-cargo-binstall) needs the crate to have a repository set in its manifest for it to find the binary download. We should only need to set it for `cargo-shuttle`, but it's nice to have for all our published crates. 

There was also an issue with the windows bin build where the tag was not included in the archive name, due to that build running the `make-artifact` command with powershell. I resolved this by changing the shell for the windows build to bash, and using a powershell override for the other commands.

I also changed the name of the directory inside the archive to be [compatible](https://github.com/cargo-bins/cargo-binstall/blob/main/SUPPORT.md#examples) with `cargo-binstall`.

And last but not least, I added the `x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` target to the linux binary builds.

title: feat: build our images with the release profile
body:
Currently our containerfile builds crates with the default debug profile, which means when `get_runtime_executable` is called it will try to install from a checked out local version of `shuttle-runtime`. This will work when making images, but fail when the deployer containers start a runtime, since the local version wont be available (even though for deployers the runtime will be installed during make images).

Changing to build the crates will release profile will also not work currently, since it looks for the runtime on the production branch.

Tldr: using debug assertions might not be enough for this, I will investigate further on wednesday.
